content: Passau is a small town located in southeastern Germany, close to the borders of Austria and the Czech Republic. It is situated at the confluence of three rivers – the Danube, the Inn, and the Ilz – which has earned it the nickname "City of Three Rivers". The town is located in a valley surrounded by hills and forests, providing scenic views to visitors. Passau is a popular destination for river cruises and a starting point for exploring the Bavarian Forest and nearby towns and cities.
